decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the key combo pieces, Phyrexian Unlife and Ad Nauseam, along with Angel's Grace to avoid losing the game from the life loss of Ad Nauseam. Using fast mana like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, along with Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to cast Ad Nauseam and draw its entire deck to either win with Lightning Storm or Laboratory Maniac. The deck also includes Pact of Negation for protection and Spoils of the Vault for finding key pieces.

The primary focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge to manipulate both players' draws and prevent opponents from attacking. The deck also includes various disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt opponents' strategies. The main win condition revolves around milling opponents out using the deck's abilities to control their draws. The deck also includes various artifacts and lands that support this control strategy, providing additional utility and consistency.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana. This mana is used to play powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, Ulamog, and Ugin, while also having access to removal through cards like Oblivion Stone and Dismember. The deck utilizes various colorless spells and artifacts to search for the Tron lands and maintain card advantage, while controlling the game and overwhelming the opponent with its big threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing low-cost, high-damage cards such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Skullcrack to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. It also leverages cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combination of efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear with burn spells like Lightning Helix and Boros Charm allows for a fast-paced, explosive playstyle aimed at overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, while also having access to utility cards like Karn Liberated and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with its efficient Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards through effects like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore, enabling powerful graveyard-based creatures like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler to be cast for little to no cost. Street Wraith and Faithless Looting also help to dig through the deck and find the necessary pieces to keep the pressure on the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early and maintain a fast tempo throughout the game.

The focus of this Aggro Abzan deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to generate value through cards like Dark Confidant and Tireless Tracker, and overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Lingering Souls. The planeswalkers, Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope, provide additional disruption and card advantage, ultimately grinding out the opponent for victory.

The main concept of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mirran Crusader while disrupting their game plan with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while cards like Restoration Angel and Flickerwisp provide additional utility and disruption. The deck aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy while maintaining a steady stream of threats to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with aggressive creatures like Kiln Fiend and Enigma Drake, while utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful attacks early in the game and finish them off with explosive combos using spells like Temur Battle Rage. The inclusion of cards like Thing in the Ice and Snapcaster Mage provide additional versatility and options for adapting to different situations during the game.

The deck focuses on building a formidable board presence by quickly enchanting hexproof creatures with powerful auras to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. By protecting the creatures with hexproof and Leyline of Sanctity, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large, evasive creatures that are difficult to deal with. The deck also includes some removal spells like Path to Exile to control the opponent's board while continuing to enhance its own creatures. Overall, the strategy revolves around creating a strong, unblockable threat that can quickly close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder, while controlling the board with Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods. The ultimate goal is to cast Scapeshift or Primeval Titan to fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with several Mountains to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent all at once. Cards like Prismatic Omen and Cinder Glade help to ensure that Valakut's ability triggers successfully for maximum damage output. This deck is reliant on assembling the combo pieces quickly to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Bloodbraid Elf and Lightning Bolt for removal and disruption, as well as ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and consistently. The deck also includes cards like Hazoret the Fervent for additional reach and finishing power. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish a fast and powerful board presence to quickly close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game with counter spells and removal until you can assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage to your opponent. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control, while Search for Tomorrow and Farseek help ramp up your mana for a faster Scapeshift. The deck aims to disrupt your opponent's game plan while setting up your win condition of dealing massive damage with Valakut triggers.

This Modern 1 vs 1 combo Infect deck focuses on using cheap spells and pump effects to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The key strategy is to play creatures with infect, such as Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, and protect them with various pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to ensure your infect creatures can get through to deal lethal damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, evasive infect creatures before they can mount a defense.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature play, utilizing cards like Young Pyromancer and Goblin Rabblemaster to swarm the board with tokens. It also includes a mix of removal and disruption spells such as Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's board and hand. The deck is able to refill its hand and generate card advantage with cards like Lingering Souls and Bedlam Reveler. The inclusion of a few utility lands like Blood Moon and Kolaghan's Command adds additional versatility to deal with different types of threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler to put pressure on the opponent quickly, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. The deck also has access to removal spells such as Path to Exile and Dismember to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. The inclusion of Lingering Souls and Geist of Saint Traft provides additional threats and resilience to the deck's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multiple color requirements.
